p: Gower et al. [ 15] showed that the global serological prevalence of people with a history of HCV—the presence of anti-HCV antibodies—was 1.6% (range 1.3–2.1%), a value that reached 2.0% among adults (defined as those older than 15 years old). The test for anti-HCV antibodies may remain positive even after virus clearance; moreover, a minimum rate may be falsely positive.
